thread.title: Inexpensive hunts available on upscale White Lake WCA
thread.title_full: Inexpensive hunts available on upscale White Lake WCA | NOLA.com

author: Todd Masson, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Inexpensive hunts available on upscale White Lake WCA
text:
Some hunts on the White Lake Wetlands Conservation Area are prohibitively expensive for anyone not named Gates or Trump, but even those of us in the unwashed riffraff can hunt the legendary waterfowl grounds in south-central Louisiana if we're lucky enough to get selected.
The Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries is now accepting applications for 2015-16 marsh and rice-field hunts on the 72,000-acre tract.
Available dates for marsh hunts are Nov. 7, 8, 12, 16, 18, 24, 28, 29; Dec. 1, 27, 29 and Jan. 2, 3, 5, 7 and 12.
Available dates for rice-field hunts are Nov. 7, 8, 10, 14, 15, 17, 19, 21, 22, 25, 30; Dec. 1, 3, 5, 6, 19, 20, 22, 26, 28, 30, and Jan. 3, 6, 8, 9, 10, 13, 15, 16 and 17.
Applications are available at www.wlf.louisiana.gov/refuge/lottery-applications , and may be hand-delivered or mailed to 2000 Quail Dr., Room 422, Baton Rouge, LA 70808. The deadline to apply is Oct. 12.
Each application must include a non-refundable $5 administrative fee paid by check or money order to the Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries.
Successful applicants will be notified by mail, and will be allowed two guests for the rice-field hunts and one guest for the marsh hunts. An additional payment of $225 will be required for the rice-field hunts and $350 for the marsh hunts.
